parts.text: Hello! I can help you practice for interviews. Which company (Amazon, Google, or Apple) and what type of interview (system design, coding, or behavioral) would you like to focus on today?
Great! We'll focus on Amazon system design interviews. I've saved your preferences. Let's get started!
Hello! Thanks for joining today's Amazon system design interview. I'm excited to work through a problem with you. Before we start, I'd love to learn a bit about your background. What's your name?
Great! To kick things off, could you please tell me your name?

args.projects: real-time messaging system and API gateway
args.name: Alice

parts.text:
Fantastic, Alice! It's great to hear about your experience in distributed systems and backend, and those projects sound very interesting.

Here's how today's system design interview will work: We'll go through a problem together, covering clarifications, requirements, data modeling, API design, architecture, and then dive deep into specific areas. It's a collaborative discussion – feel free to ask questions and think out loud. The whole thing takes about 45-60 minutes.

Are you ready to begin?

Thank you so much for your time today, Alice. That concludes our Amazon system design interview. I really enjoyed our discussion, and I particularly appreciated your structured approach to problem-solving and your strong understanding of distributed systems concepts, drawing from your experience with projects like real-time messaging.

Before we finish, do you have any questions for me about the next steps in the interview process, the timeline for feedback, the role itself, or Amazon as a company?

It was a pleasure speaking with you, and I wish you the very best with the remainder of your interview journey. Keep exploring those complex system challenges!
